etymology.description: 岭(嶺 ‘mountain ridge’) + 南 (‘south’) → 岭南 ‘south of the ranges/Lingnan’; 文化 (‘culture’) → cultural traditions of Lingnan.
etymology.interpretation: Refers to the cultural traditions of the Lingnan region south of the Nanling ranges, chiefly Guangdong, Guangxi, and Hainan. Highlights maritime openness and Cantonese, Hakka, and Teochew influences.
etymology.simplification: 嶺 → 岭 by replacing the phonetic 領 with 令 under the mountain radical to reduce strokes; 南, 文, 化 unchanged.

parts.english: mountain ridge; mountain range; mountain pass; hill
south; southern; to the south of; southward

examples.chinese: 岭南文化跨越广东、广西与海南(嶺南文化跨越廣東、廣西與海南)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐngnán wénhuà kuàyuè Guǎngdōng, Guǎngxī yǔ Hǎinán.
examples.english: Lingnan culture spans Guangdong, Guangxi, and Hainan.

examples.chinese: 海上贸易和亚热带环境影响了它的建筑、饮食与音乐(海上貿易和亞熱帶環境影響了它的建築、飲食與音樂)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎishàng màoyì hé yàrèdài huánjìng yǐngxiǎng le tā de jiànzhù, yǐnshí yǔ yīnyuè.
examples.english: Maritime trade and the subtropical environment have influenced its architecture, cuisine, and music.

examples.chinese: 在现代城市中，岭南文化通过龙舟、粤剧和园林继续传承(在現代城市中，嶺南文化通過龍舟、粵劇和園林繼續傳承)。
examples.pinyin: Zài xiàndài chéngshì zhōng, Lǐngnán wénhuà tōngguò lóngzhōu, Yuèjù hé yuánlín jìxù chuánchéng.
examples.english: In modern cities, Lingnan culture continues through dragon boat races, Cantonese opera, and classical gardens.
